result.execSummary:
The defendant Erin N Kopan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to Restitution. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

No Contact with the victim listed in 13CF0999 which was dismissed and read in. Maintain full time employment and/or school. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Sign medical releases for agent to be able to contact treating physicians. Comply with any Mental Health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
No association with any known drug users, or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. 
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol, (ie. bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: As a condition of probation, non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. Sentence credit of 2 days were granted. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Hearing on June 18, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Case called at 12:00 p.m.  Attorney Katie B Bricco in court.   Defendant Erin N Kopan did not appear.   Debra L Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bricco states that Defendant called her this morning to state that she did not have a ride to court today.  State requests a capias.    Court ordered a capias stayed until next court date.  Hearing scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on June 4, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Erin N Kopan in court with attorney Katie B Bricco.  Susan L Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 8, 2014 at 10:00 am.
